Here is a verbal portrait of calligraphers in the Tang Dynasty:

The calligraphers of the Tang Dynasty were masters of their craft, renowned for their elegant and graceful handwriting. They were highly respected figures, and their works were treasured for their beauty and artistry.

The calligraphers of the Tang Dynasty worked with a variety of materials, including paper, silk, and bamboo, and their writing tools included brushes made from animal hair and ink made from a variety of substances. They were skilled in producing a wide range of styles, including the formal and angular "clerical script," the flowing and graceful "cursive script," and the bold and powerful "seal script."

The calligraphers of the Tang Dynasty were known for their dedication to their craft and their commitment to perfecting their skills. They were also deeply spiritual individuals, and many of them were inspired by their belief in Buddhism and Daoism to create works of great beauty and depth.

Many of the most famous works of calligraphy from the Tang Dynasty have been preserved to this day, and they continue to be admired for their beauty and craftsmanship. The calligraphers of the Tang Dynasty remain an important part of the artistic heritage of China, and their contributions continue to be respected and admired by people all around the world.
